member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument
member.summary: Encapsulates the main properties and methods to create and manipulate a spreadsheet.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.FlattenAllSharedCellFormula
member.summary: Flattens shared cell formulas into respective cells. For example, if there's a shared cell formula in A2 for the range A2:A6, the shared cell formula will be individually assigned into A2, A3, A4, A5 and A6. And the shared cell formula portion will then be removed.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.CleanUpReallyEmptyCells
member.summary: This cleans up all the SLCell objects with default values. This can happen if an SLCell was assigned with say a style but no value. Then subsequently, the style is removed (set to default), thus the cell is empty.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetCells
member.summary: Get existing cells in the currently selected worksheet. WARNING: This is only a snapshot. Any changes made to the returned result are not used.
member.returns: A Dictionary of existing cells.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.HasCellValue(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates if the cell value exists.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
member.returns: True if it exists. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.HasCellValue(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Indicates if the cell value exists.
member.param: The row index.
The column index.
member.returns: True if it exists. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.HasCellValue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates if the cell value exists.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
True if having a cell formula counts as well. False otherwise.
member.returns: True if it exists. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.HasCellValue(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates if the cell value exists.
member.param: The row index.
The column index.
True if having a cell formula counts as well. False otherwise.
member.returns: True if it exists. False otherwise (also if out of bounds).

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.HasCellError(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates if the cell has an error. WARNING: SpreadsheetLight does not have a formula calculation engine, so only existing errors are reported.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
member.returns: True if there's a cell error. False otherwise (also if out of bounds).

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.HasCellError(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Indicates if the cell has an error. WARNING: SpreadsheetLight does not have a formula calculation engine, so only existing errors are reported.
member.param: The row index.
The column index.
member.returns: True if there's a cell error. False otherwise (also if out of bounds).

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the cell value given a cell reference.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
The cell value data.
member.returns: False if the cell reference is invalid. True otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValue(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the cell value given the row index and column index.
member.param: The row index.
The column index.
The cell value data.
member.returns: False if either the row index or column index (or both) are invalid. True otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValue(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the cell value given a cell reference.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".

The cell value data. If you plan to store a percentage value, set this as the value divided by 100. For example, to store 2.78%, set this value as 0.0278. Remember to set the cell style format code (say "0.00%")!
member.returns: False if the cell reference is invalid. True otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValue(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValueNumeric(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the cell value given a cell reference and a numeric value in string form. Use this when the source data is numeric and is already in string form and parsing the data into numeric form is undesirable. Note that the numeric string must be in invariant-culture mode, so "123456.789" is the accepted form even if the current culture displays that as "123456,789".
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
The cell value data.
member.returns: False if the cell reference is invalid. True otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValueNumeric(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Set the cell value given the row index and column index and a numeric value in string form. Use this when the source data is numeric and is already in string form and parsing the data into numeric form is undesirable. Note that the numeric string must be in invariant-culture mode, so "123456.789" is the accepted form even if the current culture displays that as "123456,789".
member.param: The row index.
The column index.
The cell value data.
member.returns: False if either the row index or column index (or both) are invalid. True otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValue(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Set the cell value given a cell reference. Be sure to follow up with a date format style.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
The cell value data.
member.returns: False if the cell reference is invalid. True otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValue(System.String,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the cell value given a cell reference. Be sure to follow up with a date format style.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
The cell value data.
True if using 1 Jan 1904 as the date epoch. False if using 1 Jan 1900 as the date epoch. This is independent of the workbook's Date1904 property.
member.returns: False if the cell reference is invalid. True otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValue(System.String,System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Set the cell value given a cell reference. Be sure to follow up with a date format style.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
The cell value data.

The format string used if the given date is before the date epoch. A date before the date epoch is stored as a string, so the date precision is only as good as the format string. For example, "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss" is more precise than "dd/MM/yyyy" because the latter loses information about the hours, minutes and seconds.
member.returns: False if the cell reference is invalid. True otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SetCellValue(System.String,System.DateTime,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the cell value given a cell reference. Be sure to follow up with a date format style.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
The cell value data.

The format string used if the given date is before the date epoch. A date before the date epoch is stored as a string, so the date precision is only as good as the format string. For example, "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss" is more precise than "dd/MM/yyyy" because the latter loses information about the hours, minutes and seconds.
True if using 1 Jan 1904 as the date epoch. False if using 1 Jan 1900 as the date epoch. This is independent of the workbook's Date1904 property.
member.returns: False if the cell reference is invalid. True otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetCellValueAsBoolean(System.String)
member.summary: Get the cell value as a boolean. If the cell value wasn't originally a boolean value, the return value is undetermined (but is by default false).
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
member.returns: A boolean cell value.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetCellValueAsBoolean(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the cell value as a boolean. If the cell value wasn't originally a boolean value, the return value is undetermined (but is by default false).
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".

Set true to force any cell value that looks like a boolean to be returned as a boolean. This means text stored as "1" or "TRUE" will also be considered a boolean true. Set to false to only consider true (haha pun!) booleans. The default is false.
member.returns: A boolean cell value.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetCellValueAsBoolean(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the cell value as a boolean. If the cell value wasn't originally a boolean value, the return value is undetermined (but is by default false).
member.param: The row index.
The column index.
member.returns: A boolean cell value.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetCellValueAsDateTime(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the cell value as a System.DateTime value. If the cell value wasn't originally a date/time value, the return value is undetermined.
member.param: The row index.
The column index.
True if using 1 Jan 1904 as the date epoch. False if using 1 Jan 1900 as the date epoch. This is independent of the workbook's Date1904 property.
member.returns: A System.DateTime cell value.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetCellValueAsDateTime(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the cell value as a System.DateTime value. If the cell value wasn't originally a date/time value, the return value is undetermined.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".

The format string used to parse the date value in the cell if the date is before the date epoch. A date before the date epoch is stored as a string, so the date precision is only as good as the format string. For example, "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss" is more precise than "dd/MM/yyyy" because the latter loses information about the hours, minutes and seconds.
member.returns: A System.DateTime cell value.

member.returns: A System.DateTime cell value.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.MergeWorksheetCells(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Merge cells given a corner cell of the to-be-merged rectangle of cells, and the opposite corner cell. For example, the top-left corner cell and the bottom-right corner cell. Or the bottom-left corner cell and the top-right corner cell. No merging is done if it's just one cell.
member.param: The cell reference of the corner cell, such as "A1".
The cell reference of the opposite corner cell, such as "A1".
member.returns: True if merging is successful. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.MergeWorksheetCells(System.String,System.String,DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.BorderStyleValues)
member.summary: Merge cells given a corner cell of the to-be-merged rectangle of cells, and the opposite corner cell. For example, the top-left corner cell and the bottom-right corner cell. Or the bottom-left corner cell and the top-right corner cell. No merging is done if it's just one cell. Border style properties are only applied on a successful merge.
member.param: The cell reference of the corner cell, such as "A1".
The cell reference of the opposite corner cell, such as "A1".
The border style. Default is none.
member.returns: True if merging is successful. False otherwise.

The border style. Default is none.

member.returns: True if merging is successful. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.MergeWorksheetCells(System.String,System.String,DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.BorderStyleValues,SpreadsheetLight.SLThemeColorIndexValues,System.Double)
member.summary: Merge cells given a corner cell of the to-be-merged rectangle of cells, and the opposite corner cell. For example, the top-left corner cell and the bottom-right corner cell. member.param: The cell reference of the corner cell, such as "A1".
The cell reference of the opposite corner cell, such as "A1".
The border style. Default is none.
The border theme color.
The tint applied to the theme color, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0. Negative tints darken the theme color and positive tints lighten the theme color.
member.returns: True if merging is successful. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetSharedCellFormulas
member.summary: Get existing shared cell formulas in the current worksheet in a list of SLSharedCellFormula objects. NOTE: Due to technical difficulties (read: a certain popular spreadsheet software's behaviour is confusing), any copy/insert/delete of cells/rows/columns will flatten all shared cell formula into the respective cells. WARNING: This is only a snapshot. Any changes made to the returned result are not used.
member.returns: A list of existing shared cell formulas.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.InsertHyperlink(System.String,SpreadsheetLight.SLHyperlinkTypeValues,System.String)
member.summary: Insert a hyperlink.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
The type of hyperlink.

The URL for web pages, the file path for existing files, a cell reference (such as Sheet1!A1 or Sheet1!A1:B5), a defined name or an email address. NOTE: Do NOT include the "mailto:" portion for email addresses.
member.returns: True if successful. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.InsertHyperlink(System.String,SpreadsheetLight.SLHyperlinkTypeValues,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Insert a hyperlink.
member.param: The cell reference, such as "A1".
The type of hyperlink.

The URL for web pages, the file path for existing files, a cell reference (such as Sheet1!A1 or Sheet1!A1:B5), a defined name or an email address. NOTE: Do NOT include the "mailto:" portion for email addresses.
True to overwrite the existing cell value with the hyperlink display text. False otherwise.
member.returns: True if successful. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.InsertHyperlink(System.String,SpreadsheetLight.SLHyperlinkTypeValues,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Insert a hyperlink.

The type of hyperlink.

The URL for web pages, the file path for existing files, a cell reference (such as Sheet1!A1 or Sheet1!A1:B5), a defined name or an email address. NOTE: Do NOT include the "mailto:" portion for email addresses.
The display text. Set null or an empty string to use the default.
The tooltip (or screentip) text. Set null or an empty string to ignore this.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.WriteUniqueSharedStringCount
member.summary: Set to true to write the unique shared string count property, false otherwise. The default is true. Set this to false if you get an error opening the resulting file because at a high number of text strings, SpreadsheetLight might count the number wrongly (because the Open XML specs are sort of convoluted).

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Open an existing spreadsheet, with the desired worksheet ready for use. This optimizes loading so the desired worksheet's contents are loaded directly instead of first loading the first available worksheet. Note that if the given sheet name doesn't exist, the first available worksheet is loaded.
member.param: The file name of the existing spreadsheet.
The sheet name of desired worksheet on opening the spreadsheet.

The sheet name of desired worksheet on opening the spreadsheet.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.WriteTabSelectedWorksheet
member.summary: Make sure to call this only after all worksheets are done! But before writing the workbook!

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.Save
member.summary: Saves the spreadsheet. If it's a newly created spreadsheet, the default blank file name is used. If it's an existing spreadsheet, the given file name is used. WARNING: The existing spreadsheet will be overwritten without prompts. NOTE: This is a terminal method, meaning all internal memory stores will be nulled, cleared and nuked after executing this method. If you want some data, get it before this.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the spreadsheet to a given file name. NOTE: This is a terminal method, meaning all internal memory stores will be nulled, cleared and nuked after executing this method. If you want some data, get it before this.
member.param: The file name of the spreadsheet to be saved to.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SaveAs(System.IO.Stream)

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.CloseWithoutSaving

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.AddWorksheet(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new worksheet, and selects the new worksheet as the active one.
member.param: The name should not be blank, nor exceed 31 characters. And it cannot contain these characters: \/?*[] It cannot be the same as an existing name (case-insensitive). But there's nothing stopping you from using 3 spaces as a name.
member.returns: True if the name is valid and the worksheet is successfully added. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SelectWorksheet(System.String)
member.summary: Select an existing worksheet. If the given name doesn't match an existing worksheet, the previously selected worksheet is used.
member.param: The name of an existing worksheet.
member.returns: True if there's an existing worksheet with that name and that worksheet is successfully selected. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.ShowWorksheet(System.String)
member.summary: Show the worksheet (a.k.a unhide worksheet). This includes chart sheets, dialog sheets and macro sheets.
member.param: The name of the worksheet.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.HideWorksheet(System.String)
member.summary: Hide the worksheet. This includes chart sheets, dialog sheets and macro sheets.
member.param: The name of the worksheet.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.HideWorksheet(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Hide the worksheet. This includes chart sheets, dialog sheets and macro sheets.
member.param: The name of the worksheet.
True to set the worksheet as very hidden. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.IsWorksheetHidden(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates if the worksheet is hidden. Note that if the worksheet name isn't of an existing worksheet, the return value is true. Think of a non-existent worksheet as very very hidden, like hidden in another dimension or something.
member.param: The name of the worksheet.
member.returns: True if the worksheet is hidden. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.RenameWorksheet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Rename an existing worksheet. This includes chart sheets, dialog sheets and macro sheets.
member.param: The name of the existing worksheet.

The new name for the existing worksheet. The name should not be blank, nor exceed 31 characters. And it cannot contain these characters: \/?*[] It cannot be the same as an existing name (case-insensitive).
member.returns: True if renaming is successful. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.CopyWorksheet(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copy the contents of a worksheet to another worksheet. The current worksheet cannot be the source of the copy operation, nor the destination of the copy operation.
member.param: The worksheet to be copied from. This cannot be the current worksheet.

The worksheet to be copied to. If this doesn't exist, a new worksheet is created. If it's an existing worksheet, the contents of the existing worksheet will be overwritten. The new worksheet cannot be the currently selected worksheet.
member.returns: True if copying is successful. False otherwise

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.DeleteWorksheet(System.String)
member.summary: Delete a worksheet. The currently selected worksheet cannot be deleted.
member.param: The name of the worksheet to be deleted.
member.returns: True if successful. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetCurrentWorksheetName
member.summary: Get the worksheet name of the currently selected worksheet.
member.returns: The currently selected worksheet name.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetWorksheetNames
member.summary: Get a list of names of existing worksheets currently in the spreadsheet, excluding chart sheets, macro sheets and dialog sheets. This is identical to GetSheetNames() but is more appropriately named.
member.returns: A list of names of existing worksheets.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetSheetNames
member.summary: Get a list of names of existing worksheets currently in the spreadsheet, excluding chart sheets, macro sheets and dialog sheets. This is identical to GetWorksheetNames() but is kept to maintain function overload consistency with the IncludeAll parameter version.
member.returns: A list of names of existing worksheets.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetSheetNames(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a list of names of existing sheets currently in the spreadsheet.
member.param: True to include chart sheets, macro sheets and dialog sheets. False to limit to only worksheets.
member.returns: A list of names of existing sheets.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.GetWorksheetStatistics
member.summary: Get statistical information on the currently selected worksheet. NOTE: The information is only current at point of retrieval.
member.returns: An SLWorksheetStatistics object with the information.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.MoveWorksheet(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Move a worksheet to a new position in the spreadsheet.

The new 1-based position index. Use 1 for 1st position, 2 for 2nd position and so on.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.FreezePanes(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Freeze panes in the worksheet (for the first workbook view). Will do nothing if both parameters are zero (because there's nothing to freeze). Will also do nothing if either of the parameters is equal to their respective limits (maximum number of rows, or maximum number of columns).
member.param: Number of top-most rows to keep in place.
Number of left-most columns to keep in place.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.UnfreezePanes
member.summary: Unfreeze the frozen panes in the worksheet (for the first workbook view).

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SplitPanes(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Split panes in the worksheet (for the first workbook view). Will do nothing if both number of rows and number of columns are zero (because there's nothing to split). Will also do nothing if either is equal to their respective limits (maximum number of rows, or maximum number of columns).
member.param: Number of top-most rows above the horizontal split line.
Number of left-most columns left of the vertical split line.
True if the row and column headings are shown. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SplitPanes(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Split panes in the worksheet (for the first workbook view). Will do nothing if both number of rows and number of columns are zero (because there's nothing to split). Will also do nothing if either is equal to their respective limits (maximum number of rows, or maximum number of columns).
member.param: Number of top-most rows above the horizontal split line.
Number of left-most columns left of the vertical split line.
True if the row and column headings are shown. False otherwise.
This is more useful when row and column headings are shown. This will be the height of the column heading in points.
This is more useful when row and column headings are shown. This will be the width of the row heading in points.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.SplitPanes(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Split panes in the worksheet (for the first workbook view). Will do nothing if both number of rows and number of columns are zero (because there's nothing to split). Will also do nothing if either is equal to their respective limits (maximum number of rows, or maximum number of columns). The underlying engine tries to guess the individual row heights and column widths. Then the horizontal and vertical split lines are placed based on the guesses. Forcing the row and column dimensions to fit the split lines might mean the worksheet looking oddly sized.
member.param: Number of top-most rows above the horizontal split line.
Number of left-most columns left of the vertical split line.
True if the row and column headings are shown. False otherwise.
This is more useful when row and column headings are shown. This will be the height of the column heading in points.
This is more useful when row and column headings are shown. This will be the width of the row heading in points.
Set true to force the worksheet's row height and column width to fit the given horizontal and vertical splits. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLDocument.UnsplitPanes
member.summary: Unsplit the split panes in the worksheet (for the first workbook view).

member.summary: Chart customization options for bar and column charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLBarChartOptions.GapWidth
member.summary: The gap width between bar or column clusters (in the same data series) as a percentage of bar or column width, ranging between 0% and 500% (both inclusive). The default is 150%.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLBarChartOptions.GapDepth
member.summary: The gap depth between bar or columns clusters (between different data series) as a percentage of bar or column width, ranging between 0% and 500% (both inclusive). The default is 150%. This is only used for 3D chart version.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLBarChartOptions.Overlap
member.summary: The amount of overlapping for bars and columns on 2D bar/column charts, ranging from -100 to 100 (both inclusive). The default is 0. For stacked and "100% stacked" bar/column charts, this should be 100.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart
member.summary: Encapsulates properties and methods for a chart to be inserted into a worksheet.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.IsStylish
member.summary: True if follow latest Excel styling defaults (but no guarantees because I might not be able to afford to keep buying latest Office/Excel).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.RoundedCorners
member.summary: Specifies whether the chart has rounded corners. In Microsoft Excel, you might find this setting under "Border Styles" when formatting the chart area.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.ShowEmptyCellsAs
member.summary: The default is to show empty cells with a gap (or whichever option is appropriate for the chart). Note that "Zero" and "Span" are used mostly for line, scatter and radar charts. Use "Zero" to force a zero value, and "Span" to connect data points across the empty cell.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.ShowDataLabelsOverMaximum
member.summary: Indicates whether data labels over the maximum value of the chart is shown. The default value is true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.Perspective
member.summary: This is double that's shown in Excel. Excel values range from 0 to 120 degrees. So this is 0 to 240 units. "Default" rotation angle is 30 (15 degrees). Did Microsoft want to make full use of the byte range value?

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.ChartName
member.summary: A friendly name for the chart. By default, this is in the form of "Chart #", where "#" is a number.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.Title
member.summary: The chart title. By default the chart title is hidden, so make sure to show it if chart title properties are set.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.Floor
member.summary: The floor of 3D charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.SideWall
member.summary: The side wall of 3D charts. Note that contour charts don't show the side wall, even though they're technically 3D charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.BackWall
member.summary: The back wall of 3D charts. Note that contour charts don't show the back wall, even though they're technically 3D charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.PlotArea
member.summary: The plot area.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.PrimaryTextAxis
member.summary: The primary chart text axis. This is usually the horizontal axis at the bottom (bar charts have them on the left). Depending on the type of chart, this can be a category, date or value axis.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.PrimaryValueAxis
member.summary: The primary chart value axis. This is usually the vertical axis on the left (bar charts have them at the bottom).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.DepthAxis
member.summary: The depth axis for 3D charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.SecondaryTextAxis
member.summary: The secondary chart text axis. This is usually the horizontal axis at the top (bar charts have them on the left initially until you show this axis). Depending on the type of chart, this can be a category, date or value axis.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.SecondaryValueAxis
member.summary: The secondary chart value axis. This is usually the vertical axis on the right (bar charts have them at the top).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.ShowDataTable
member.summary: Specifies if the data table is shown.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.DataTable
member.summary: The data table of the chart.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.Legend
member.summary: The chart legend.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.Fill
member.summary: Fill properties.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.Border

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.SetChartPosition(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the position of the chart relative to the top-left of the worksheet.
member.param: Top position of the chart based on row index. For example, 0.5 means at the half-way point of the 1st row, 2.5 means at the half-way point of the 3rd row.
Left position of the chart based on column index. For example, 0.5 means at the half-way point of the 1st column, 2.5 means at the half-way point of the 3rd column.
Bottom position of the chart based on row index. For example, 5.5 means at the half-way point of the 6th row, 7.5 means at the half-way point of the 8th row.
Right position of the chart based on column index. For example, 5.5 means at the half-way point of the 6th column, 7.5 means at the half-way point of the 8th column.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.GetDataSeriesOptions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the options for a specific data series.
member.param: The index of the data series. This is 1-based indexing, so it's 1 for the 1st data series, 2 for the 2nd data series and so on.
member.returns: The data series options for the specific data series. If the index is out of bounds, a default is returned.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.SetDataSeriesOptions(System.Int32,SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLDataSeriesOptions)
member.summary: Set the options for a given data series.
member.param: The index of the data series. This is 1-based indexing, so it's 1 for the 1st data series, 2 for the 2nd data series and so on.
The data series options.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.ShowPrimaryTextAxis
member.summary: Show the primary text (category/date/value) axis. This has no effect if the chart has no primary axes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.HidePrimaryTextAxis
member.summary: Hide the primary text (category/date/value) axis. This has no effect if the chart has no primary axes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.ShowPrimaryValueAxis
member.summary: Show the primary value axis. This has no effect if the chart has no primary axes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.HidePrimaryValueAxis
member.summary: Hide the primary value axis. This has no effect if the chart has no primary axes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.ShowDepthAxis
member.summary: Show the depth axis. This has no effect if the chart has no depth axis (that is, not a true 3D chart).

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.HideDepthAxis
member.summary: Hide the depth axis. This has no effect if the chart has no depth axis (that is, not a true 3D chart).

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.ShowSecondaryTextAxis
member.summary: Show the secondary text (category/date/value) axis. This has no effect if the chart has no secondary axes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.HideSecondaryTextAxis
member.summary: Hide the secondary text (category/date/value) axis. This has no effect if the chart has no secondary axes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.ShowSecondaryValueAxis
member.summary: Show the secondary value axis. This has no effect if the chart has no secondary axes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLChart.HideSecondaryValueAxis
member.summary: Hide the secondary value axis. This has no effect if the chart has no secondary axes.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLCreateChartOptions
member.summary: General chart customization options on chart creation.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLCreateChartOptions.RowsAsDataSeries
member.summary: True if rows contain the data series. False if columns contain the data series. Set to null if SpreadsheetLight is to determine data series orientation. If the number of columns in a given cell range is more than or equal to the number of rows, then it's decided that rows contain data series (else it's columns). The default value is null.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLCreateChartOptions.ShowHiddenData
member.summary: True if hidden data is used in the chart. False otherwise. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLCreateChartOptions.IsStylish
member.summary: True to use default chart styling from latest version of Excel (but no guarantees on conformity or Excel version). False otherwise. The default value is true.

member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLCreateChartOptions.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions
member.summary: Chart customization options for pie, bar-of-pie, pie-of-pie and doughnut charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.VaryColors
member.summary: Each data point shall have a different color. The default is "true".

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.FirstSliceAngle
member.summary: Angle of the first slice, ranging from 0 degrees to 360 degrees.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.HoleSize
member.summary: The size of the hole in a doughnut chart, ranging from 10% to 90% of the diameter of the doughnut chart. If the doughnut chart is exploded, the diameter is taken to be that when it's not exploded.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.GapWidth
member.summary: The gap width between the first pie and the second bar or pie chart, ranging from 0 to 500 (both inclusive). This is for bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.SecondPieSize
member.summary: The size of the second bar or pie of the bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie chart as a percentage of the size of the first pie. This ranges from 5% to 200% (both inclusive).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.Line
member.summary: Line properties for the connecting line for bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.Shadow
member.summary: Shadow properties for the connecting line for bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.Glow
member.summary: Glow properties for the connecting line for bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie charts.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.SoftEdge
member.summary: Soft edge properties for the connecting line for bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie charts.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLPieChartOptions. It is recommended to use SLChart.CreatePieChartOptions().

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.SplitSeriesByPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Split the data series by position where the second plot contains the last N values. This is only for bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie charts.
member.param: The last N values used in the second plot.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.SplitSeriesByValue(System.Double)
member.summary: Split the data series by value where the second plot contains all values less than a maximum value. This is only for bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie charts.
member.param: The maximum value.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.SplitSeriesByPercentage(System.Double)
member.summary: Split the data series by percentage where the second plot contains all values less than a percentage of the sum. This is only for bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie charts.
member.param: The maximum percentage of the sum.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLPieChartOptions.SplitSeriesByCustom(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Split the data series by selecting data points for the second plot. This is only for bar-of-pie or pie-of-pie charts.
member.param: The indices of the data points of the data series. The index is 1-based, so "1,3,4" sets the 1st, 3rd and 4th data point in the second plot.

member.summary: Label alignment for the category axis. This is ignored for date axes.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.LabelOffset
member.summary: This is the label distance from the axis, ranging from 0 to 1000 (both inclusive). The default is 100.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.MaximumDate
member.summary: The maximum value on the axis. A null value means it's automatically set. WARNING: This is used for date axes. It's also shared with value axes. If it's set for category axes, chart behaviour is not defined.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.MinimumDate
member.summary: The minimum value on the axis. A null value means it's automatically set. WARNING: This is used for date axes. It's also shared with value axes. If it's set for category axes, chart behaviour is not defined.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.MaximumValue
member.summary: The maximum value on the axis. A null value means it's automatically set. WARNING: This is used for value axis. It's also shared with date axes. If it's set for category axes, chart behaviour is not defined.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.MinimumValue
member.summary: The minimum value on the axis. A null value means it's automatically set. WARNING: This is used for value axis. It's also shared with date axes. If it's set for category axes, chart behaviour is not defined.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.ValueMajorUnit
member.summary: The major unit on the axis. A null value means it's automatically set. This is for the value axis.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.ValueMinorUnit
member.summary: The minor unit on the axis. A null value means it's automatically set. This is for the value axis.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.LogarithmicScale
member.summary: Logarithmic scale of the axis, ranging from 2 to 1000 (both inclusive). A null value means it's not used. This is for the value axis.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.BaseUnit
member.summary: The base unit for date axes. A null value means it's automatically set.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.CrossBetween
member.summary: This sets how the axis crosses regarding the tick marks (or position of the axis). Use Between for "between tick marks", and MidpointCategory for "on tick marks".

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.NoMultiLevelLabels
member.summary: Indicates if labels are shown as flat text. If false, then the labels are shown as a hierarchy. This is used only for category axes. The default is true.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.ClearShapeProperties
member.summary: Clear all styling shape properties. Use this if you want to start styling from a clean slate.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetAsCategoryAxis
member.summary: Set this axis as a category axis. WARNING: This only works if it's a category/date axis. This fails if it's already a value axis.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetAsDateAxis
member.summary: Set this axis as a date axis. WARNING: This only works if it's a category/date axis. This fails if it's already a value axis.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetAutomaticDateMajorUnit
member.summary: Set the major unit for date axes to be automatic.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetDateMajorUnit(System.Int32,DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.TimeUnitValues)
member.summary: Set the major unit for date axes.
member.param: A positive value. Suggested range is 1 to 999999999 (both inclusive).
The time unit.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetAutomaticDateMinorUnit
member.summary: Set the minor unit for date axes to be automatic.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetDateMinorUnit(System.Int32,DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.TimeUnitValues)
member.summary: Set the minor unit for date axes.
member.param: A positive value. Suggested range is 1 to 999999999 (both inclusive).
The time unit.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetDisplayUnits(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Charts.BuiltInUnitValues,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the display units on the axis. This is for value axis.
member.param: Built-in unit types.
True to show the display units label on the chart. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.RemoveDisplayUnits
member.summary: Remove the display units on the axis. This is for value axis.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetAutomaticOtherAxisCrossing
member.summary: Set the corresponding value axis to cross this axis at an automatic value.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetOtherAxisCrossing(System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the corresponding value axis to cross this axis at a given category number. Suggested range is 1 to 31999 (both inclusive). This is for category axis. WARNING: Internally, this is used for category, date and value axes. Remember to set the axis type.
member.param: Category number to cross at.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetOtherAxisCrossing(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Set the corresponding value axis to cross this axis at a given date. This is for date axis. WARNING: Internally, this is used for category, date and value axes. Remember to set the axis type.
member.param: Date to cross at.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetOtherAxisCrossing(System.Double)
member.summary: Set the corresponding value axis to cross this axis at a given value. This is for value axis. WARNING: Internally, this is used for category, date and value axes. If it's already a value axis, you can't set the axis type.
member.param: Axis value to cross at.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTextAxis.SetMaximumOtherAxisCrossing
member.summary: Set the corresponding value axis to cross this axis at the maximum value.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTrendline.TrendlineType
member.summary: Trendline type.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTrendline.PolynomialOrder
member.summary: Polynomial trendline order. This is the power of the polynomial, and is between 2 (default value) and 6 (both inclusive). This is only applicable if the trendline type is polynomial.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTrendline.Period
member.summary: Moving average period, and is only 2 (default value) or 3. THis is only applicable if the trendline type is "moving average".

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTrendline.TrendlineName
member.summary: Trendline name.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTrendline.Forward
member.summary: Forward period. Default value is 0 (if null it's also 0). From Open XML SDK documentation: This is the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends after the data for the series that is being trended. On non-scatter charts, the value shall be a multiple of 0.5. (Excel seems to NOT adhere to the restriction though...)

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTrendline.Backward
member.summary: Backward period. Default value is 0 (if null it's also 0). From Open XML SDK documentation: This is the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trend line extends before the data for the series that is being trended. On non-scatter charts, the value shall be 0 or 0.5. (Excel seems to NOT adhere to the restriction though...)

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTrendline.Intercept
member.summary: The intercept value where the trendline crosses the Y-axis. This is only supported if the trendline type is exponential, linear or polynomial. Default value is 0 (if null then no intercept value is set).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTrendline.DisplayEquation
member.summary: Set true to display equation on chart. False otherwise.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Charts.SLTrendline.DisplayRSquared
member.summary: Set true to display R-squared value on chart. False otherwise.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatting
member.summary: Encapsulates properties and methods for conditional formatting. This simulates the DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.ConditionalFormatting class.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatting.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLConditionalFormatting, given cell references of opposite cells in a cell range.
member.param: The cell reference of the start cell of the cell range to be conditionally formatted, such as "A1". This is typically the top-left cell.
The cell reference of the end cell of the cell range to be conditionally formatted, such as "A1". This is typically the bottom-right cell.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatting.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLConditionalFormatting, given row and column indices of opposite cells in a cell range.
member.param: The row index of the start row. This is typically the top row.
The column index of the start column. This is typically the left-most column.
The row index of the end row. This is typically the bottom row.
The column index of the end column. This is typically the right-most column.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatting.SetDataBar(SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatDataBarValues)
member.summary: Set a data bar formatting with built-in types.
member.param: A built-in data bar type.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatting.SetCustomDataBar(System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatMinMaxValues,System.String,SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatMinMaxValues,System.String,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Set a custom data bar formatting.
member.param: True to show only the data bar. False to show both data bar and value.
The minimum length of the data bar as a percentage of the cell width. The default value is 10.
The maximum length of the data bar as a percentage of the cell width. The default value is 90.
The conditional format type for the shortest bar.
The value for the shortest bar. If is Value, you can just set this to "0".
The conditional format type for the longest bar.
The value for the longest bar. If is Value, you can just set this to "0".
The color of the data bar.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatting.SetCustomDataBar(System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatMinMaxValues,System.String,SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatMinMaxValues,System.String,SpreadsheetLight.SLThemeColorIndexValues)
member.summary: Set a custom data bar formatting.
member.param: True to show only the data bar. False to show both data bar and value.
The minimum length of the data bar as a percentage of the cell width. The default value is 10.
The maximum length of the data bar as a percentage of the cell width. The default value is 90.
The conditional format type for the shortest bar.
The value for the shortest bar. If is Value, you can just set this to "0".
The conditional format type for the longest bar.
The value for the longest bar. If is Value, you can just set this to "0".
The theme color to be used for the data bar.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatting.SetCustomDataBar(System.Boolean,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatMinMaxValues,System.String,SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatMinMaxValues,System.String,SpreadsheetLight.SLThemeColorIndexValues,System.Double)
member.summary: Set a custom data bar formatting.
member.param: True to show only the data bar. False to show both data bar and value.
The minimum length of the data bar as a percentage of the cell width. The default value is 10.
The maximum length of the data bar as a percentage of the cell width. The default value is 90.
The conditional format type for the shortest bar.
The value for the shortest bar. If is Value, you can just set this to "0".
The conditional format type for the longest bar.
The value for the longest bar. If is Value, you can just set this to "0".
The theme color to be used for the data bar.
The tint applied to the theme color, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0. Negative tints darken the theme color and positive tints lighten the theme color.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLConditionalFormatting.HighlightCellsGreaterThan(System.Boolean,System.String,SpreadsheetLight.SLStyle)

member.param: True for greater than or equal to. False for strictly greater than.
The value to be compared with.

member.summary: The minimum value.

member.summary: The maximum value.

member.summary: The fill color.

member.summary: The border color.

member.summary: The fill color for negative values.

member.summary: The border color for negative values.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.AxisColor
member.summary: The axis color.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.MinLength
member.summary: The minimum length of the data bar as a percentage of the cell width. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.MaxLength
member.summary: The maximum length of the data bar as a percentage of the cell width. The default value is 90. It is recommended to keep this to a maximum (haha) of 100.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.ShowBarOnly
member.summary: Specifies if only the data bar is shown. Set to false to show both data bar and value.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.Border
member.summary: Specifies if there's a border. This is an Excel 2010 specific feature.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.Gradient
member.summary: Specifies if the fill color has a gradient. This is an Excel 2010 specific feature.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.Direction
member.summary: The bar direction. This is an Excel 2010 specific feature.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.NegativeBarColorSameAsPositive
member.summary: Specifies if the fill color for negative values is the same as the positive one. This is an Excel 2010 specific feature.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.NegativeBarBorderColorSameAsPositive
member.summary: Specifies if the border color for negative values is the same as the positive one. This is an Excel 2010 specific feature.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDataBarOptions.AxisPosition
member.summary: Specifies the axis position. This is an Excel 2010 specific feature.

member.summary: Set a solid fill.
member.param: The theme color used.
The tint applied to the theme color, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0. Negative tints darken the theme color and positive tints lighten the theme color.
Transparency of the color ranging from 0% to 100%. Accurate to 1/1000 of a percent.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLFill.SetLinearGradient(SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLGradientPresetValues,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Set a linear gradient given a preset setting.
member.param: The preset to be used.

The interpolation angle ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. 0 degrees mean from left to right, 90 degrees mean from top to bottom, 180 degrees mean from right to left and 270 degrees mean from bottom to top. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.

The radial gradient direction.

The tint applied to the theme color, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0. Negative tints darken the theme color and positive tints lighten the theme color.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLFormat3D
member.summary: Encapsulates 3D shape properties. Works together with SLRotation3D class. This simulates some properties of DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Scene3DType and DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Shape3DType classes. The reason for this mixing is because Excel separates different properties from both classes into 2 separate sections on the user interface (3-D Format and 3-D Rotation). Hence SLRotation3D and SLFormat3D classes instead of straightforward mapping of the SDK Scene3DType and Shape3DType classes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLPicture.SetPosition(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the position of the picture relative to the top-left of the worksheet.
member.param: Top position based on row index. For example, 0.5 means at the half-way point of the 1st row, 2.5 means at the half-way point of the 3rd row.
Left position based on column index. For example, 0.5 means at the half-way point of the 1st column, 2.5 means at the half-way point of the 3rd column.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLPicture.SetInnerShadow(System.Drawing.Color,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Obsolete. Set an inner shadow of the picture.
member.param: The color used for the inner shadow.
Transparency of the shadow color ranging from 0% to 100%. Accurate to 1/1000 of a percent.
Shadow blur, ranging from 0 pt to 2147483647 pt (but consider a maximum of 100 pt). Accurate to 1/12700 of a point. Default value is 0 pt.

Angle of shadow projection based on picture, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. 0 degrees means the shadow is to the right of the picture, 90 degrees means it's below, 180 degrees means it's to the left and 270 degrees means it's above. Distance of shadow away from picture, ranging from 0 pt to 2147483647 pt (but consider a maximum of 200 pt). Accurate to 1/12700 of a point. Default value is 0 pt.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLPicture.Set3DZDistance(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Obsolete. Set the Z distance.
member.param: The Z distance, ranging from -4000 pt to 4000 pt. Accurate to 1/12700 of a point. Default value is 0 pt.

member.summary: Obsolete. Set the camera and light properties.
member.param: A preset set of properties for the camera, which can be overridden. Default value is OrthographicFront.
Field of view, ranging from 0 degrees to 180 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.
Zoom percentage, ranging from 0% to 2147483.647%. Accurate to 1/1000 of a percent.
Camera latitude angle, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.
Camera longitude angle, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.
Camera revolution angle, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.
The type of light used. Default value is ThreePoints.
The direction of the light. Default value is Top.
Light rig latitude angle, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.
Light rig longitude angle, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.
Light rig revolution angle, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.
member.remarks: Imagine the screen to be the X-Y plane, the positive X-axis pointing to the right, and the positive Y-axis pointing up. The positive Z-axis points perpendicularly from the screen towards you. The latitude value increases as you turn around the X-axis, using the right-hand rule. The longitude value increases as you turn around the Y-axis, using the left-hand rule (meaning it decreases according to right-hand rule). The revolution value increases as you turn around the Z-axis, using the right-hand rule. And if you're mapping values directly from Microsoft Excel, don't treat the X, Y and Z values as values related to the axes. The latitude maps to the Y value, longitude maps to the X value, and revolution maps to the Z value.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection
member.summary: Encapsulates properties and methods for specifying reflection effects. This simulates the DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Reflection class.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.BlurRadius
member.summary: Blur radius of the reflection, ranging from 0 pt to 2147483647 pt. A suggested range is 0 pt to 100 pt. Accurate to 1/12700 of a point. Default value is 0 pt.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.StartOpacity
member.summary: Start opacity of the reflection, ranging from 0% to 100%. Accurate to 1/1000 of a percent. Default value is 100%.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.StartPosition
member.summary: Position of start opacity of the reflection, ranging from 0% to 100%. Accurate to 1/1000 of a percent. Default value is 0%.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.EndAlpha
member.summary: End alpha of the reflection, ranging from 0% to 100%. Accurate to 1/1000 of a percent. Default value is 0%.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.EndPosition
member.summary: Position of end alpha of the reflection, ranging from 0% to 100%. Accurate to 1/1000 of a percent. Default value is 100%.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.Distance
member.summary: Distance of the reflection from the origin, ranging from 0 pt to 2147483647 pt. A suggested range is 0 pt to 100 pt. Accurate to 1/12700 of a point. Default value is 0 pt.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.Direction
member.summary: Direction of the alpha gradient, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. 0 degrees means to the right, 90 degrees is below, 180 degrees is to the right, and 270 degrees is above. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree. Default value is 0 degrees.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.FadeDirection
member.summary: Direction to fade the reflection, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. 0 degrees means to the right, 90 degrees is below, 180 degrees is to the right, and 270 degrees is above. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree. Default value is 90 degrees.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.HorizontalRatio
member.summary: Horizontal scaling ratio in percentage. A negative ratio flips the reflection horizontally. Accurate to 1/1000 of a percent. Default value is 100%.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.VerticalRatio
member.summary: Vertical scaling ratio in percentage. A negative ratio flips the reflection vertically. Accurate to 1/1000 of a percent. Default value is 100%.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.HorizontalSkew
member.summary: Horizontal skew angle, ranging from -90 degrees to 90 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree. Default value is 0 degrees.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.VerticalSkew
member.summary: Vertical skew angle, ranging from -90 degrees to 90 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree. Default value is 0 degrees.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.Alignment
member.summary: Sets the origin for the size scaling, angle skews and distance offsets. Default value is Bottom.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLReflection.RotateWithShape
member.summary: True if the reflection should rotate as well. False otherwise.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLRotation3D
member.summary: Encapsulates 3D rotation properties. Works together with SLFormat3D class. This simulates some properties of DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Scene3DType and DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Drawing.Shape3DType classes. The reason for this mixing is because Excel separates different properties from both classes into 2 separate sections on the user interface (3-D Format and 3-D Rotation). Hence SLRotation3D and SLFormat3D classes instead of straightforward mapping of the SDK Scene3DType and Shape3DType classes.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLRotation3D.X
member.summary: Longitude angle ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLRotation3D.Y
member.summary: Latitude angle ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLRotation3D.Z
member.summary: Revolution angle ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLRotation3D.Perspective
member.summary: Perspective angle ranging from 0 degrees to 180 degrees. However, a suggested maximum is 120 degrees.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLRotation3D.DistanceZ
member.summary: Distance from the ground, ranging from -2147483648 pt to 2147483647 pt. However, a suggested range is -4000 pt to 4000 pt.

member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLRotation3D.

member.summary: Shadow blur, ranging from 0 pt to 2147483647 pt (but consider a maximum of 100 pt). Accurate to 1/12700 of a point.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLShadowEffect.Angle
member.summary: Angle of shadow projection, ranging from 0 degrees to 359.9 degrees. 0 degrees means the shadow is to the right of the picture, 90 degrees means it's below, 180 degrees means it's to the left and 270 degrees means it's above. Accurate to 1/60000 of a degree. Default value is 0 degrees.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.Drawing.SLShadowEffect.Distance
member.summary: Distance of shadow away from source object, ranging from 0 pt to 2147483647 pt (but consider a maximum of 200 pt). Accurate to 1/12700 of a point. Default value is 0 pt.

member.summary: Encapsulates properties and methods for handling rich string types. This includes the CommentText class, InlineString class and SharedStringItem class. This simulates the (abstract) DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.RstType class.
member.remarks: This also take on double duty as rich text for other purposes such as charts. We do this so other developers don't have to learn another class.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLRstType.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLRstType. It is recommended to use CreateRstType() of the SLDocument class.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLRstType.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Set the text. If text formatting is needed, use one of the AppendText() functions.
member.param: The text.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLRstType.GetText
member.summary: Get the text. This is the plain text string, and not the rich text runs.
member.returns: The plain text.

member.summary: Get a list of rich text runs.
member.returns: A list of rich text runs.

member.param: The new list of rich text runs for replacing.

member.summary: Append given text with a given font style.

The font style.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportDataFieldTypeValues
member.summary: The type of data fields to be imported, whether by delimiters/separators or in fixed width.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportDataFieldTypeValues.Delimited
member.summary: Data is separated by character delimiters.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportDataFieldTypeValues.FixedWidth
member.summary: Data is separated by fixed width columns.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues
member.summary: The type of column data format.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues.General
member.summary: Numeric values will be converted to numbers, date values to dates and remaining values to text.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues.Text
member.summary: Text format.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues.DateMDY
member.summary: The value will be parsed as a date in the order of month, day, year. Failing that, any given custom date formats will be used to parse the value. Failing that, the value is parse generically as a date. And failing that, the value is set as text.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues.DateDMY
member.summary: The value will be parsed as a date in the order of day, month, year. Failing that, any given custom date formats will be used to parse the value. Failing that, the value is parse generically as a date. And failing that, the value is set as text.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues.DateYMD
member.summary: The value will be parsed as a date in the order of year, month, day. Failing that, any given custom date formats will be used to parse the value. Failing that, the value is parse generically as a date. And failing that, the value is set as text.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues.DateMYD
member.summary: The value will be parsed as a date in the order of month, year, day. Failing that, any given custom date formats will be used to parse the value. Failing that, the value is parse generically as a date. And failing that, the value is set as text.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues.DateDYM
member.summary: The value will be parsed as a date in the order of day, year, month. Failing that, any given custom date formats will be used to parse the value. Failing that, the value is parse generically as a date. And failing that, the value is set as text.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues.DateYDM
member.summary: The value will be parsed as a date in the order of year, day, month. Failing that, any given custom date formats will be used to parse the value. Failing that, the value is parse generically as a date. And failing that, the value is set as text.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues.Skip
member.summary: This column will be skipped.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions
member.summary: Text import options for importing text data.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.DataFieldType
member.summary: Indicates if fields are separated by character delimiters or are of fixed width. The default is Delimited.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.DefaultFixedWidth
member.summary: The default number of characters when columns are of fixed width. If no width is set for a column, this will be used. By default, this is 8 characters.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.UseTabDelimiter
member.summary: Indicates if a tab character is a delimiter. By default, this is true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.UseSemicolonDelimiter
member.summary: Indicates if a semicolon is a delimiter. By default, this is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.UseCommaDelimiter
member.summary: Indicates if a comma is a delimiter. By default, this is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.UseSpaceDelimiter
member.summary: Indicates if a space character is a delimiter. By default, this is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.UseCustomDelimiter
member.summary: Indicates if a custom character is used as a delimiter. By default, this is false. Use the CustomDelimiter property to set the custom delimiter character.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.CustomDelimiter
member.summary: The custom delimiter character. This is used only when UseCustomDelimiter is true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.MergeDelimiters
member.summary: Indicates if consecutive delimiters are treated as one.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.HasTextQualifier
member.summary: Indicates if data enclosed within text qualifiers is taken as text. The default is true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.TextQualifier
member.summary: Data enclosed within this qualifier will automatically be taken as text. The text qualifier will be removed. The default is the double quote character.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.ImportStartRowIndex
member.summary: The row in the text data source to begin importing.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.Culture
member.summary: The culture used for parsing numbers and dates. The default is the InvariantCulture.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.NumberStyles
member.summary: The number styles used for parsing numeric data. The default is NumberStyles.Any.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding used to read the data source. The default is Encoding.Default.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.PreserveSpace
member.summary: Indicates if space characters in the data source are preserved (after data column separation by delimiters). By default, this is true.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLTextImportOptions, and assuming that the data source is character delimited.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.#ctor(SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportDataFieldTypeValues)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLTextImportOptions.
member.param: Whether the data source is character delimited or of fixed width.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.SetColumnFormat(System.Int32,SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportColumnFormatValues)
member.summary: Set the column data format type.
member.param: The column index in the data source. This is 1-based indexing, so it's 1 for the 1st data source column, 2 for the 2nd data source column and so on.
The column data format type.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.SkipColumn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Skip a particular data source column. This is equivalent to using the SetColumnFormat() function with a Skip data format type.
member.param: The data source column to skip. This is 1-based indexing, so it's 1 for the 1st data source column, 2 for the 2nd data source column and so on.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.ClearColumnFormats
member.summary: Clear all column data formats. This is effectively making all columns to be of General type.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.AddCustomDateFormat(System.String)
member.summary: Add custom date formats (this is the .NET date format code, not Excel's format code). This is used to parse any date data into a date, and is done first before trying other generic date parsing operations.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.ClearCustomDateFormats
member.summary: Clear all custom date formats.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.SetFixedWidth(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the width of a column in number of characters for separating data columns. This is used when the data source is specified as of fixed width. If no width is specified, the DefaultFixedWidth is used.
member.param: The column index of the data source. This is 1-based indexing, so it's 1 for the 1st data source column, 2 for the 2nd data source column and so on.
The column width in number of characters.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTextImportOptions.Clone
member.summary: Clone an instance of SLTextImportOptions.
member.returns: An SLTextImportOptions object.

member.summary: This returns the width in points

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics
member.summary: Statistical information about a worksheet.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics.StartRowIndex
member.summary: Index of the first row used. This includes empty rows but might be styled. This returns -1 if the worksheet is empty (but check for negative values instead of -1 just in case). This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics.StartColumnIndex
member.summary: Index of the first column used. This includes empty columns but might be styled. This returns -1 if the worksheet is empty (but check for negative values instead of -1 just in case). This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics.EndRowIndex
member.summary: Index of the last row used. This includes empty rows but might be styled. This returns -1 if the worksheet is empty (but check for negative values instead of -1 just in case). This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics.EndColumnIndex
member.summary: Index of the last column used. This includes empty columns but might be styled. This returns -1 if the worksheet is empty (but check for negative values instead of -1 just in case). This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics.NumberOfCells
member.summary: Number of cells set in the worksheet. This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics.NumberOfEmptyCells
member.summary: Number of cells set in the worksheet that is empty. This could be that a style was set but no cell value given. This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics.NumberOfRows
member.summary: Number of rows in the worksheet. This includes empty rows (no cells in that row but a row style was applied, or that row only has empty cells). This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics.NumberOfColumns
member.summary: Number of columns in the worksheet. This includes empty columns (no cells in that column but a column style was applied, or that column only has empty cells). This is read-only.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLWorksheetStatistics.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLWorksheetStatistics. But it's quite useless on its own. Use GetWorksheetStatistics() of the SLDocument class.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLCacheSource.IsWorksheetSource
member.summary: If true, use worksheet. If false, use consolidation. If null, use extension list.

member.summary: The color for the high point.
