member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetLocation(System.String)
member.summary: Set the location of the sparkline group given a cell reference. Use this if your data source is either 1 row of cells or 1 column of cells.
member.param: The cell reference such as "A1".

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetLocation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the location of the sparkline group given cell references of opposite cells in a cell range. Note that the cell range has to be a 1-dimensional vector, meaning it's either a single row or single column. Note also that the length of the vector must be equal to either the number of rows or number of columns in the data source range.
member.param: The cell reference of the start cell of the location cell range, such as "A1". This is either the top-most or left-most cell.
The cell reference of the end cell of the location cell range, such as "A1". This is either the bottom-most or right-most cell.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetLocation(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the location of the sparkline group given cell references of opposite cells in a cell range. Note that the cell range has to be a 1-dimensional vector, meaning it's either a single row or single column. Note also that the length of the vector must be equal to either the number of rows or number of columns in the data source range.
member.param: The cell reference of the start cell of the location cell range, such as "A1". This is either the top-most or left-most cell.
The cell reference of the end cell of the location cell range, such as "A1". This is either the bottom-most or right-most cell.
True if the data source has its series in rows. False if it's in columns. This only comes into play if the data source has the same number of rows as its columns.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the location of the sparkline group given a row and column index. Use this if your data source is either 1 row of cells or 1 column of cells.
member.param: The row index.
The column index.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the location of the sparkline group given row and column indices of opposite cells in a cell range. Note that the cell range has to be a 1-dimensional vector, meaning it's either a single row or single column. Note also that the length of the vector must be equal to either the number of rows or number of columns in the data source range.
member.param: The row index of the start row. This is typically the top row.
The column index of the start column. This is typically the left-most column.
The row index of the end row. This is typically the bottom row.
The column index of the end column. This is typically the right-most column.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the location of the sparkline group given row and column indices of opposite cells in a cell range. Note that the cell range has to be a 1-dimensional vector, meaning it's either a single row or single column. Note also that the length of the vector must be equal to either the number of rows or number of columns in the data source range.
member.param: The row index of the start row. This is typically the top row.
The column index of the start column. This is typically the left-most column.
The row index of the end row. This is typically the bottom row.
The column index of the end column. This is typically the right-most column.
True if the data source has its series in rows. False if it's in columns. This only comes into play if the data source has the same number of rows as its columns.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetGeneralAxis
member.summary: Set the horizontal axis as general axis type.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetDateAxis(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the horizontal axis as date axis type, given a cell range containing the date values. Note that this means the cell range is a 1-dimensional vector, meaning it's a single row or single column. Note also that this probably means the length of the vector is the same as your location cell range.
member.param: The cell reference of the start cell of the date cell range, such as "A1". This is either the top-most or left-most cell.
The cell reference of the end cell of the date cell range, such as "A1". This is either the bottom-most or right-most cell.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetDateAxis(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the horizontal axis as date axis type, given a worksheet name and a cell range containing the date values. Note that this means the cell range is a 1-dimensional vector, meaning it's a single row or single column. Note also that this probably means the length of the vector is the same as your location cell range.
member.param: The name of the source worksheet.
The cell reference of the start cell of the date cell range, such as "A1". This is either the top-most or left-most cell.
The cell reference of the end cell of the date cell range, such as "A1". This is either the bottom-most or right-most cell.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetDateAxis(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the horizontal axis as date axis type, given row and column indices of opposite cells in a cell range containing the date values. Note that this means the cell range is a 1-dimensional vector, meaning it's a single row or single column. Note also that this probably means the length of the vector is the same as your location cell range.
member.param: The row index of the start row. This is typically the top row.
The column index of the start column. This is typically the left-most column.
The row index of the end row. This is typically the bottom row.
The column index of the end column. This is typically the right-most column.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLSparklineGroup.SetDateAxis(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set the horizontal axis as date axis type, given a worksheet name, and row and column indices of opposite cells in a cell range containing the date values. Note that this means the cell range is a 1-dimensional vector, meaning it's a single row or single column. Note also that this probably means the length of the vector is the same as your location cell range.
member.param: The name of the source worksheet.
The row index of the start row. This is typically the top row.
The column index of the start column. This is typically the left-most column.
The row index of the end row. This is typically the bottom row.
The column index of the end column. This is typically the right-most column.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill
member.summary: Encapsulates properties and methods for specifying fill options, such as foreground and background colors. This simulates the DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.Fill class.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill.PatternForegroundColor
member.summary: Color of the foreground. This is read-only. Use one of the methods to set the color.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill.PatternBackgroundColor
member.summary: Color of the background. This is read-only. Use one of the methods to set the color.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill.PatternType
member.summary: Pattern type of the fill. This is read-only. Use one of the methods to set the pattern type.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill.GradientType
member.summary: Gradient type of the fill. This is read-only. Use one of the methods to set the gradient type.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill.GradientDegree
member.summary: The angle in the direction from which the first color starts. The end color is at 180 degrees from this angle. 0 degrees means start from left, 90 degrees from the top, 180 degrees from the right and 270 degrees from below. This is read-only. Use one of the methods to set the angle.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill.GradientLeft
member.summary: Specifies position of the first color at the left edge, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 means the position is on the left edge of the cell, and 1.0 means it's on the right edge. This is read-only. Use one of the methods to set the position.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill.GradientRight
member.summary: Specifies position of the first color at the right edge, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 means the position is on the left edge of the cell, and 1.0 means it's on the right edge. This is read-only. Use one of the methods to set the position.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill.GradientTop
member.summary: Specifies position of the first color at the top edge, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 means the position is on the top edge of the cell, and 1.0 means it's on the bottom edge. This is read-only. Use one of the methods to set the position.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFill.GradientBottom
member.summary: Specifies position of the first color at the bottom edge, ranging 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 means the position is on the top edge of the cell, and 1.0 means it's on the bottom edge. This is read-only. Use one of the methods to set the position.

member.summary: Set a custom gradient fill. Used in conjunction with AppendGradientStop().
member.param: The gradient fill type. Default value is Linear.

The angle in the direction from which the first color starts. The end color is at 180 degrees from this angle. 0 degrees means start from left, 90 degrees from the top, 180 degrees from the right and 270 degrees from below.
Specifies position of the first color at the left edge, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 means the position is on the left edge of the cell, and 1.0 means it's on the right edge.
Specifies position of the first color at the right edge, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 means the position is on the left edge of the cell, and 1.0 means it's on the right edge.
Specifies position of the first color at the top edge, ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 means the position is on the top edge of the cell, and 1.0 means it's on the bottom edge.
Specifies position of the first color at the bottom edge, ranging 0.0 to 1.0. A 0.0 means the position is on the top edge of the cell, and 1.0 means it's on the bottom edge.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont
member.summary: Encapsulates properties and methods for fonts. This simulates the DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.Font class.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.FontName
member.summary: Name of the font.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.CharacterSet
member.summary: The font character set of the font text. It is recommended not to explicitly set this property. This is used when the given font name is not available on the computer, and a suitable alternative font is used. The character set value is operating system dependent. Possible value (not exhaustive): 0 - ANSI_CHARSET, 1 - DEFAULT_CHARSET, 2 - SYMBOL_CHARSET.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.FontFamily
member.summary: The font family of the font text. It is recommended not to explicitly set this property. Values as follows (might not be exhaustive): 0 - Not applicable, 1 - Roman, 2 - Swiss, 3 - Modern, 4 - Script, 5 - Decorative.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.Bold
member.summary: Specifies if the font text should be in bold.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.Italic
member.summary: Specifies if the font text should be in italic.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.Strike
member.summary: Specifies if the font text should have a strikethrough.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.Outline
member.summary: Specifies if the inner and outer borders of each character of the font text should be displayed. This makes the font text appear as if in bold.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.Shadow
member.summary: Specifies if there's a shadow behind and at the bottom-right of the font text. It is a Macintosh compatibility setting. It is recommended not to use this property because SpreadsheetML applications are not required to use this property.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.Condense
member.summary: Specifies if the font text should be squeezed together. It is a Macintosh compatibility setting. It is recommended not to use this property because SpreadsheetML applications are not required to use this property.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.Extend
member.summary: Specifies if the font text should be stretched out. It is a legacy spreadsheet compatibility setting. It is recommended not to use this property because SpreadsheetML applications are not required to use this property.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.FontColor
member.summary: The color of the font text.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.FontSize
member.summary: The size of the font text in points (1 point is 1/72 of an inch).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.Underline
member.summary: Specifies the underline formatting style of the font text.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the vertical position of the font text.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.FontScheme
member.summary: Specifies the font scheme. Used particularly as part of a theme definition. A major font scheme is usually used for heading text. A minor font scheme is used for body text.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLFont. It is recommended to use CreateFont() of the SLDocument class.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.SetFont(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the font, given a font name and font size.
member.param: The name of the font to be used.
The size of the font in points.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.SetFont(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.FontSchemeValues,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the font, given a font scheme and font size.
member.param: The font scheme. If None is given, the current theme's minor font will be used (but if the theme is changed, the text remains as of the old theme's minor font instead of the new theme's minor font).
The size of the font in points.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.SetFontThemeColor(SpreadsheetLight.SLThemeColorIndexValues)
member.summary: Set the font color with one of the theme colors.
member.param: The theme color to be used.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.SetFontThemeColor(SpreadsheetLight.SLThemeColorIndexValues,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the font color with one of the theme colors, modifying the theme color with a tint value.
member.param: The theme color to be used.
The tint applied to the theme color, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0. Negative tints darken the theme color and positive tints lighten the theme color.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLFont.Clone
member.summary: Clone a new instance of SLFont with identical font settings.
member.returns: An SLFont object with identical font settings.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLProtection
member.summary: Encapsulates properties and methods for cell content protection. The properties don't take effect unless the worksheet is protected. This simulates the DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.Protection class.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLProtection.Locked
member.summary: Specifies if the cell is locked. If locked and the worksheet is protected, then the worksheet's protection options are ignored.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLProtection.Hidden
member.summary: Specifies if the cell is hidden. If hidden and the worksheet is protected, then cell contents are hidden and only cell values are displayed. For example, the cell formula is hidden, but the value of the cell formula is still displayed.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLStyle.FormatCode
member.summary: Specifies the (number) format code for this style. Note that the format has to be in invariant-culture mode. So "#,##0.000" is accepted but "#.##0,000" isn't. For cultures with a period as the thousands separator and a comma for the decimal digit separator... sorry.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable
member.summary: Encapsulates properties and methods for specifying tables. This simulates the DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.Table class.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.HasAutoFilter
member.summary: Indicates if the table has auto-filter.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.DisplayName
member.summary: There should be no spaces in the given value. Because display names of tables have to be unique across the entire spreadsheet, this can only be checked when the table is actually inserted into the worksheet. If the display name is duplicate, a new display name will be automatically assigned upon insertion.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.HasTotalRow
member.summary: Indicates if the table has a totals row.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.HasBandedRows
member.summary: Indicates if the table has banded rows.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.HasBandedColumns
member.summary: Indicates if the table has banded columns.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.HasFirstColumnStyled
member.summary: Indicates if the table has special formatting for the first column.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.HasLastColumnStyled
member.summary: Indicates if the table has special formatting for the last column.

member.summary: Set the table style with a built-in style.
member.param: A built-in table style.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.RemoveTotalRowLabelFunction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Remove the label text or function in the totals row.
member.param: The table column index. For example, 1 for the 1st table column, 2 for the 2nd table column and so on.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.SetTotalRowLabel(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Set the label text in the totals row. Be sure to set true first.
member.param: The table column index. For example, 1 for the 1st table column, 2 for the 2nd table column and so on.
The label text.
member.returns: True if successful. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.SetTotalRowFunction(System.Int32,SpreadsheetLight.SLTotalsRowFunctionValues)
member.summary: Set the function in the totals row. Be sure to set true first.
member.param: The table column index. For example, 1 for the 1st table column, 2 for the 2nd table column and so on.
The function type.
member.returns: True if successful. False otherwise.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLTable.Sort(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: To sort data within the table. Note that the sorting is only done when the table is inserted into the worksheet.
member.param: The table column index. For example, 1 for the 1st table column, 2 for the 2nd table column and so on.
True to sort in ascending order. False to sort in descending order.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName
member.summary: This simulates the DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.DefinedName class.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.Text
member.summary: The text of the defined name.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.Name
member.summary: The name of the defined name. Names starting with "_xlnm" are reserved.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.Comment
member.summary: User comment.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.CustomMenu
member.summary: Custom menu text.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.Description
member.summary: Description text.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.Help
member.summary: Help topic for display.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.StatusBar
member.summary: Status bar text.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.LocalSheetId
member.summary: The sheet index (0-based indexing) that's the scope of the defined name. If null, the defined name applies to the entire spreadsheet.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.Hidden
member.summary: Specifies if the defined name is hidden in the user interface. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.Function
member.summary: Specifies if the defined name refers to a user-defined function. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.VbProcedure
member.summary: Specifies if the defined name is related to an external function, command or executable code. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.Xlm
member.summary: Specifies if the defined name is related to an external function, command or executable code. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.FunctionGroupId
member.summary: Specifies the function group index if the defined name refers to a function. Refer to Open XML specifications for the meaning of the values. For example, 1 is for "Financial" and 2 is for "Date and Time".

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.ShortcutKey
member.summary: Specifies the keyboard shortcut for the defined name.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.PublishToServer
member.summary: Specifies if the defined name is included in a spreadsheet that's published or rendered on a web or application server. The default value is false.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLDefinedName.WorkbookParameter
member.summary: Specifies that the defined name is used as a parameter of a spreadsheet that's published or rendered on a web or application server. The default value is false.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterTypeValues
member.summary: The type of header or footer.

member.summary: First page.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterTypeValues.Odd
member.summary: Odd-numbered pages.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterTypeValues.Even
member.summary: Even-numbered pages.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues
member.summary: Header and footer format codes.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.Left
member.summary: This is a positional code. Internally, it's "&L" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.Center
member.summary: This is a positional code. Internally, it's "&C" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.Right
member.summary: This is a positional code. Internally, it's "&R" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.PageNumber
member.summary: Page number. Excel interface displays "&[Page]" but internally it's "&P" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.NumberOfPages
member.summary: Number of pages. Excel interface displays "&[Pages]" but internally it's "&N" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.Date
member.summary: Current date. Excel interface displays "&[Date]" but internally it's "&D" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.Time
member.summary: Current time. Excel interface displays "&[Time]" but internally it's "&T" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.FilePath
member.summary: File path. Excel interface displays "&[Path]" but internally it's "&Z" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.FileName
member.summary: File name. Excel interface displays "&[File]" but internally it's "&F" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.SheetName
member.summary: Sheet name. Excel interface displays "&[Tab]" but internally it's "&A" (without quotes).

member.name: F:SpreadsheetLight.SLHeaderFooterFormatCodeValues.ResetFont
member.summary: This resets the font styles. Use this when the previous section of text has formatting and the next section of text should have normal font styles.

member.summary: Width of comment box in units of points. For practical purposes, the width is a minimum of 1 pt.

member.summary: Height of comment box in units of points. For practical purposes, the height is a minimum of 1 pt.

member.summary: Fill properties. Note that this is repurposed, and some of the methods and properties can't be directly translated to a VML-equivalent (which is how comment styles are stored).

member.summary: The transparency value of the first gradient point measured in percentage, ranging from 0% to 100% (both inclusive).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLComment.GradientToTransparency
member.summary: The transparency value of the last gradient point measured in percentage, ranging from 0% to 100% (both inclusive).

member.summary: Set null for automatic color.

member.summary: Line weight in points.

member.summary: Line style.

member.summary: Horizontal text alignment.

member.summary: Set the comment text.
member.param: The comment text.

member.summary: Set the comment text given rich text content.
member.param: The rich text content

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLComment.SetPosition(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the position of the comment box. NOTE: This isn't an exact science. The positioning depends on the DPI of the computer's screen.
member.param: Top position of the comment box based on row index. For example, 0.5 means at the half-way point of the 1st row, 2.5 means at the half-way point of the 3rd row.
Left position of the comment box based on column index. For example, 0.5 means at the half-way point of the 1st column, 2.5 means at the half-way point of the 3rd column.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLComment.SetPositionMargin(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the position of the comment box given the top and left margins measured in points. It is suggested to use SetPosition() instead. This method is provided as a means of convenience. NOTE: This isn't an exact science. The positioning depends on the DPI of the computer's screen.
member.param: Top margin in points. This is measured from the top-left corner of the cell A1.
Left margin in points. This is measured from the top-left corner of the cell A1.

member.summary: Set the dash style of the comment box.
member.param: The dash style.

member.summary: Set the dash style of the comment box.
member.param: The dash style.
The end cap of the lines.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell
member.summary: Encapsulates properties and methods for representing a merged cell range. This simulates the DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.MergeCell class. The actual merging of cells is done by a SLDocument function. This class is for supporting purposes.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell.StartRowIndex
member.summary: The row index of the top row in the merged cell range. This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell.StartColumnIndex
member.summary: The column index of the left column in the merged cell range. This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell.EndRowIndex
member.summary: The row index of the bottom row in the merged cell range. This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell.EndColumnIndex
member.summary: The column index of the right column in the merged cell range. This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell.IsValid
member.summary: Indicates if the merged cell range is valid. This is read-only.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLMergeCell.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell.FromIndices(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Form a SLMergeCell given a corner cell of the to-be-merged rectangle of cells, and the opposite corner cell. For example, the top-left corner cell and the bottom-right corner cell. Or the bottom-left corner cell and the top-right corner cell.
member.param: The row index of the corner cell.
The column index of the corner cell.
The row index of the opposite corner cell.
The column index of the opposite corner cell.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell.FromMergeCell(DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.MergeCell)
member.summary: Form a SLMergeCell from a DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.MergeCell class.
member.param: The source DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.MergeCell class.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLMergeCell.ToMergeCell
member.summary: Form a DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.MergeCell class from this SLMergeCell class.
member.returns: A DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.MergeCell class.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings
member.summary: Encapsulates page and print settings for a sheet (worksheets, chartsheets and dialogsheets). This simulates DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.SheetProperties, DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.PrintOptions, DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.PageMargins, DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.PageSetup, DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.HeaderFooter and DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.SheetView classes. For chartsheets, the DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.ChartSheetProperties (instead of SheetProperties) and DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Spreadsheet.ChartSheetPageSetup (instead of PageSetup) classes are involved.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.HasTabColor
member.summary: Specifies if there's a tab color. This is read-only.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.TabColor
member.summary: The tab color.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ShowFormulas
member.summary: Show or hide the cell formulas. NOTE: This has nothing to do with the formula bar, but whether the sheet shows cell formulas instead of calculated results.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ShowGridLines
member.summary: Show or hide the grid lines between rows and columns.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ShowRowColumnHeaders
member.summary: Show or hide the row and column headers.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ShowRuler
member.summary: Show or hide the ruler on the worksheet. The ruler is only seen when the worksheet view is in "page layout" mode.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.View
member.summary: Worksheet view type.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ZoomScale
member.summary: Zoom magnification for current view, ranging from 10% to 400%. If you want to set a zoom value for the page break view, make sure to set the View property to PageBreakPreview.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ZoomScaleNormal
member.summary: Zoom magnification for the normal view, ranging from 10% to 400%. A return value of 0% means the automatic setting is used. If the view is set to normal, this value is ignored if ZoomScale is also set.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ZoomScalePageLayoutView
member.summary: Zoom magnification for the page layout view, ranging from 10% to 400%. A return value of 0% means the automatic setting is used. If the view is set to page layout, this value is ignored if ZoomScale is also set.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.PrintHorizontalCentered
member.summary: Center horizontally on page when printing. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.PrintVerticalCentered
member.summary: Center vertically on page when printing. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.PrintHeadings
member.summary: Print row and column headings. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.PrintGridLines
member.summary: Print grid lines. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.LeftMargin
member.summary: The left margin in inches.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.RightMargin
member.summary: The right margin in inches.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.TopMargin
member.summary: The top margin in inches.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.BottomMargin
member.summary: The bottom margin in inches.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.HeaderMargin
member.summary: The header margin in inches.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.FooterMargin
member.summary: The footer margin in inches.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.PaperSize
member.summary: The paper size. The default is Letter.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.FirstPageNumber
member.summary: The page number set for the first printed page.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.Scale
member.summary: The printing scale. This is read-only. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.FitToWidth
member.summary: The number of horizontal pages to fit into a printed page. This is read-only. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.FitToHeight
member.summary: The number of vertical pages to fit into a printed page. This is read-only. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.PageOrder
member.summary: Page order when printed. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.Orientation
member.summary: Page orientation.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.BlackAndWhite
member.summary: Specifies if the page is printed in black and white.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.Draft
member.summary: Specifies if the page is printed in draft mode (without graphics).

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.CellComments
member.summary: Specifies how to print cell comments. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.Errors
member.summary: Specifies how to print for cells with errors. This doesn't apply to chart sheets.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.HorizontalDpi
member.summary: Horizontal print resolution.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.VerticalDpi
member.summary: Vertical print resolution.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.Copies
member.summary: The number of copies to print. The minimum number is 1 copy. There are no maximum number of copies, however Excel uses 9999 copies as a maximum.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.OddHeaderText
member.summary: The text in the odd-numbered page header. Note that this is the default used.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.OddFooterText
member.summary: The text in the odd-numbered page footer. Note that this is the default used.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.EvenHeaderText
member.summary: The text in the even-numbered page header. Note that this only activates when is true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.EvenFooterText
member.summary: The text in the even-numbered page footer. Note that this only activates when is true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.FirstHeaderText
member.summary: The text in the first page's header. Note that this only activates when is true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.FirstFooterText
member.summary: The text in the first page's footer. Note that this only activates when is true.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.DifferentOddEvenPages
member.summary: Specifies if different headers and footers are set for odd- and even-numbered pages. If false, then the text in odd-numbered page header and footer is used, even if there's text set in even-numbered page header and footer.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.DifferentFirstPage
member.summary: Specifies if a different header and footer is set for the first page. If false, any text set in the first page header and footer is ignored.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ScaleWithDocument
member.summary: Scale with the document.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.AlignWithMargins
member.summary: Align header and footer margins with page margins.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of SLPageSettings. It is recommended to use GetPageSettings() of the SLDocument class.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.SetTabColor(SpreadsheetLight.SLThemeColorIndexValues)
member.summary: Sets the tab color of the sheet.
member.param: The theme color to be used.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.SetTabColor(SpreadsheetLight.SLThemeColorIndexValues,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the tab color of the sheet.
member.param: The theme color to be used.
The tint applied to the theme color, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0. Negative tints darken the theme color and positive tints lighten the theme color.

member.summary: Set normal margins.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.SetWideMargins
member.summary: Set wide margins.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.SetNarrowMargins
member.summary: Set narrow margins.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ScalePage(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Adjust the page a given percentage of the normal size.
member.param: The scale percentage between 10% and 400%.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetLight.SLPageSettings.ScalePage(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Fit to a given number of pages wide, and a given number of pages high.
member.param: Number of pages wide. Minimum is 1 page (default).
Number of pages high. Minimum is 1 page (default).

member.summary: Append text to the odd-numbered page header.

member.summary: Append text to the odd-numbered page header.
